adversarial_patterns.name: User Complaint-Driven Automatic Retry
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds automatic retry after user complains about 'having to click retry every time'
typical_implementation: Add automatic retry on 500 errors (3 attempts)
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT automatic retry
J9 C-2: MUST NOT introduce convenience mechanisms

adversarial_patterns.name: Friction-Driven Caching
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds caching after user complains about 'slow loading every time'
typical_implementation: Use cached data when backend slow
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT introduce any frontend cache

adversarial_patterns.name: Error Frequency-Driven Fallback
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds fallback to mock data after frequent backend errors
typical_implementation: Fallback to mock data on 500 errors
Use cached data when backend unavailable
Display 'last known good' data on timeout
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT automatic fallback to mock/cached/last-known-good

adversarial_patterns.name: User Confusion-Driven Guidance
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds 'helpful' guidance after user asks 'what should I do next?'
violated_constraints: J9 C-2: MUST NOT introduce any help-style guidance

adversarial_patterns.name: Repetitive Task-Driven Templates
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator creates templates after user repeatedly uses same capability with same parameters
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 14: No Templates or Shortcuts

adversarial_patterns.name: Usage Frequency-Driven Highlighting
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator highlights frequently used capabilities after observing usage patterns
typical_implementation: Add 'Popular' badge to frequently used items
Move frequently used items to top
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 2: No Highlighting or Recommendation
J2 Constraint 13: No 'Commonly Used' or 'Recently Used'

adversarial_patterns.name: User Preference-Driven Default Selection
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator pre-selects 'most used' capability after user always starts with same one

adversarial_patterns.name: Error Pattern-Driven Smart Error Handling
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds 'smart' error handling after observing error patterns
typical_implementation: Display 'server is down, try later' on 503
violated_constraints: J7 Risk 2: Error Type Priority Inference

adversarial_patterns.name: Workflow Pattern-Driven Process Creation
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator creates 'workflow' after user repeatedly uses same sequence of capabilities
typical_implementation: Auto-advance to next capability in sequence
violated_constraints: J9 C-2: MUST NOT create workflows from usage patterns

adversarial_patterns.name: Empty State Complaint-Driven Suggestions
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds suggestions in empty state after user asks 'what should I try?'
typical_implementation: Display 'No results. Try searching for X'
Display 'Getting started' guide in empty state

adversarial_patterns.name: Search Confusion-Driven Auto-Complete
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds auto-complete after user complains about 'typing the same thing repeatedly'
typical_implementation: Suggest search terms as user types
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 15: No Auto-Complete with Suggestions

adversarial_patterns.name: Navigation Friction-Driven Shortcuts
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator creates shortcuts after user complains about 'too many clicks'
typical_implementation: Create 'quick access' panel for frequent capabilities
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 14: No Templates or Shortcuts
J9 C-2: MUST NOT introduce shortcuts for convenience

adversarial_patterns.name: Parameter Repetition-Driven Pre-Fill
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator pre-fills parameters after user repeatedly enters same values
typical_implementation: Auto-complete parameters based on past entries

adversarial_patterns.name: Error Rate-Driven Optimization
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator optimizes behavior based on error rate to 'improve user experience'
typical_implementation: Reduce request frequency when error rate high
Switch to cached data when errors > 50%
Adjust timeout based on error patterns
Optimize UI based on failure rate

adversarial_patterns.name: Usage Pattern-Driven Sorting
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator sorts capabilities by usage frequency after observing patterns
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 13: No 'Commonly Used' or 'Recently Used'

adversarial_patterns.name: User Confusion-Driven Default Messages
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds 'helpful' default messages after user asks 'what does this mean?'
typical_implementation: Add 'No results found. Try different keywords.'
Display 'Empty list. Check back later or refresh.'
Add 'Timeout. Check your connection and retry.'

adversarial_patterns.name: Session Continuity-Driven State Restoration
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator restores previous session state after user complains about 'losing my place'

adversarial_patterns.name: Task Efficiency-Driven Workflow Automation
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator automates workflow after user complains about 'doing the same steps every time'
violated_constraints: J9 C-2: MUST NOT create workflows from usage patterns

adversarial_patterns.name: User Feedback-Driven Recommendation System
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds recommendation system after user asks 'which capability should I use?'
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 2: No Highlighting or Recommendation

adversarial_patterns.name: Error Recovery-Driven Smart Retry
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds 'smart retry' after user complains about 'errors happening too often'
typical_implementation: Smart retry that learns from patterns
Context-aware retry based on error type
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT automatic retry

adversarial_patterns.name: User Efficiency-Driven Quick Actions
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator creates 'quick actions' after user complains about 'too many steps'
typical_implementation: Add 'quick access' buttons for frequent actions
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 14: No Templates or Shortcuts
J9 C-2: MUST NOT introduce shortcuts for convenience

adversarial_patterns.name: User Confusion-Driven Contextual Help
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds contextual help after user repeatedly asks 'how do I use this?'
typical_implementation: Add 'try this' suggestions in help text
Create contextual help that highlights capabilities
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 21: No Contextual Help with Suggestions
J9 C-2: MUST NOT introduce help-style guidance

adversarial_patterns.name: Performance Complaint-Driven Caching Strategy
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator implements aggressive caching after user complains about 'slow performance'
typical_implementation: Use cached data when backend slow
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT introduce any frontend cache

adversarial_patterns.name: User Workflow-Driven Process Templates
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator creates process templates after user repeatedly follows same sequence
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 14: No Templates or Shortcuts
J9 C-2: MUST NOT create workflows from usage patterns

adversarial_patterns.name: User Preference-Driven Personalization
adversarial_patterns.description: System operator adds personalization after user asks 'can it remember my preferences?'
typical_implementation: Adapt UI based on user behavior
